labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.66-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75718 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdnsoijsonjsdisdoj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Bug 1: 1.Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two empty reports. 4. On the first empty report preview, click Add expense > Create expense. 5. Complete the flow to create an expense in the first report. Bug 2: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two reports. 4. Rename the reports above to A and B respectively. 5. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual. 6. Enter amount > Next. 7. On confirm page, enter merchant. 8. On confirm page, click Report field. 9. Select Report A. 10. Click Create expense. 11. Go back to workspace chat. ## Expected Result: Bug 1: The new expense will be created in the first report. Bug 2: The new expense will be created in Report A. ## Actual Result: Bug 1: The new expense is created in the second report when it is created from the first report. Bug 2: The new expense is created in Report B, but it opens Report A after creating the expense. This issue also happens when Step 6 is performed in the workspace chat, or when submitting expense in self DM to workspace chat with the same Step 8 to 11. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07377b2c-f248-4c79-8a31-01037aef8d66 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9da831a1-7146-4ebe-8b46-15feebb04261 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.65-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** No **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify ## Action Performed: 1. Create a workspace 2. Enable Rules 3. Go to Categories 4. Click on a category 5. Click on "Flag amounts over" 6. Click on Type ## Expected Result: Small copy update to insert the word "daily": > **Category total** > Flag total daily category spend per expense report. ## Actual Result: The copy doesn't include the word "daily", but that's how the feature works. It will throw a violation if the total of expenses with the same category and the same expense date on the same report exceed the limit. > **Category total** > Flag total category spend per expense report. ## Workaround: N/A copy change. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Change option row and push inputs chevrons to new look

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

body:
Now that we have changed the chevrons (the little > icon) of the workspace editor and expenses/reports, it's time to bring the consistency over to push inputs and option rows For all pushrows and options rows: Spec: Notes: - Icon goes from 20px -> 16px - Icon goes from 100% opacity to 50% opacity - Icon should be 100% opacity on hover - We wanna make sure we do a test build of this before we merge it into the product - All other layout should stay the same cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr

Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Click "Workspaces" tab 3. Open the Workspace with Netsuite connected 4. Click "Accounting" > "Export" 5. Click "Invoice Item" ("Select existing"/"Expensify Invoice Line Item" is selected and integration is synced) 6. Click "Invoice Item" field 7. Click on "Expensify invoice expense" 8. Click outside to close RHP 9. Click "Export" > "Invoice Item" > "Invoice Item" field 10. Click "Expensify Invoice Line Item" ## Expected Result: After close the RHP and select "Expensify Invoice Line Item", should be navigated back to "Invoice item" on the RHP. ## Actual Result: After close the RHP and select "Expensify Invoice Line Item", the RHP is closed. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eb520800-0f63-42d9-81b1-4e8eb32b6990 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
